benchmark_details.name: TRACE
benchmark_details.overview: TRACE is a novel benchmark designed to evaluate continual learning in large language models (LLMs), consisting of 8 distinct datasets spanning challenging tasks including domain-specific tasks, multilingual capabilities, code generation, and mathematical reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of continual learning for LLMs, assessing their capabilities in various domains after sequential training.

data.source: Eight standardized datasets covering various tasks including ScienceQA, FOMC, MeetingBank, C-STANCE, 20Minuten, Py150, NumGLUE, and more.
data.annotation: Curated for specific knowledge and reasoning capabilities, ensuring diversity and challenge.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on performance shifts in task-specific evaluations and general tasks pre- and post-training.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better retention of general abilities and instruction-following capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against multiple LLMs including LLaMA-2 and Vicuna models across various tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated based on rigorous testing against the outlined metrics using multiple LLMs.
